intro: Geonoma roraimae, commonly known as the Roraima fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is native to the rainforests of South America, particularly in the region of Roraima in Venezuela. The plant is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds that are often covered in a fine, silky layer of hairs. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is typically found growing on rocky outcrops or in the understory of dense tropical forests. Due to its unique habitat and appearance, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
